metadata.title: Git Integration for SDD Workflow
metadata.description: Integrate git operations into the SDD workflow with optional, permission-based branch creation, commits, and PR management
metadata.author: claude-code
objectives: Enable automatic branch creation when starting work on a spec
Support atomic commits when completing tasks
Push branches to remote for collaboration and PR creation
Generate pull requests when specs are completed
Maintain git metadata in spec JSON files
Provide manual CLI commands for explicit git operations
Keep git integration optional and configurable via project settings
assumptions: Single-user development workflow (single developer per spec/branch)
Feature branch per spec - each spec has its own dedicated branch
SDD git commands are the primary workflow for spec-related git operations
Manual git operations are allowed but not tracked in spec metadata
Users can disable git integration entirely via configuration
Each git operation (branch, commit, push, PR) can be individually enabled/disabled

task-3-1-1.description: cmd_git_init(): Initialize git integration, create config, verify repo and gh CLI availability. Must check gh CLI early: (1) Run check_gh_cli() during init, (2) Warn user if gh not available/authenticated with clear installation instructions, (3) Store gh availability status in config, (4) Allow init to proceed even if gh unavailable (user can still use manual git commands). task-3-1-3.title: Implement git-commit command
task-3-1-3.description: cmd_git_commit(): Commit changes for task. Options: --message (custom message), --files <paths> (stage specific files with git add), --all (stage all changes with git add --all), --amend (amend previous commit). Default: commit already-staged files. Staging behavior: --all stages everything, --files stages specific paths, no flag uses existing staging area.

journal.title: Implementation: Repository Detection Functions
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Implemented all four core git repository detection functions in src/claude_skills/claude_skills/common/git_operations.py:

**Functions Implemented:**
1. check_git_repo(path) - Uses 'git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree' to detect git repositories
2. get_current_branch(path) - Uses 'git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD' with special handling for detached HEAD states
3. get_base_branch(path) - Intelligently detects main vs master by checking both local and remote branches
4. get_remote_url(path, remote) - Retrieves remote URLs with support for custom remote names

**Key Design Decisions:**
- Custom GitError exception for git-specific failures provides clear error context
- All functions accept optional path parameter for flexibility (defaults to current directory)
- Comprehensive error handling for timeouts, missing git binary, and non-git directories
- 5-second timeout on all git commands prevents hanging on slow operations
- Subprocess module used for clean command execution with proper error capture

**Code Quality:**
- Full type hints on all functions and parameters
- Comprehensive docstrings with usage examples
- Follows existing patterns from paths.py and spec.py modules
- Exported via common/__init__.py for easy importing

**Testing:**
- Created 25 unit tests with 100% pass rate
- Tests use mocking to avoid actual git operations (faster, more reliable)
- Coverage includes happy paths, error conditions, timeouts, and edge cases
- Verified with actual repository: detected feat2 branch, main base, GitHub remote

**Integration:**
- Added to common module alongside existing utilities
- Updated __all__ exports in common/__init__.py
- Ready for use by Phase 1 tasks (branch management, commits, PRs)

**Next Steps:**
This task unblocks task-1-1-2 (branch management), task-1-1-3 (commit creation), and task-1-1-4 (PR creation functions).
